Description: Crescentic bronze blade of a battle-axe: with three rear tangs. The five lateral binding-holes are misaligned. The blade is lightly corroded, with traces of the original wooden haft surviving in the corrosion product near the butt. The cutting edge is not very sharp but there are signs of wear. There is a thin surface crack on one face.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) (said to be from)
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. A. W. Budge in 'Archaeologica: or Miscellaneous Tracts relating to Antiquity' 53 (London, 1892), 93, pl. II, fig. 4
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (84)
